Yes, the Lakehouse Khao Yai eco-resort offers a range of sustainable dining options that promote eco-tourism and support local communities. Here are some of the sustainable dining options you can expect:

1. Organic restaurant: The resort has its own organic restaurant that serves a variety of locally sourced and organic dishes. The restaurant sources many of its ingredients from the resort's organic farm, and the menu changes according to what's in season.

2. Farm-to-table dining: The resort offers farm-to-table dining experiences, where visitors can tour the organic farm and then enjoy a meal prepared with fresh, locally grown ingredients.

3. Traditional Thai cuisine: The resort offers a range of authentic Thai dishes that showcase the flavors and spices of the local cuisine. Many dishes include organic ingredients sourced from the resort's own farm.

4. Sustainable seafood: The resort supports sustainable fishing practices and serves a range of seafood dishes that use locally caught, sustainable fish and shellfish.

5. Zero-waste dining: The resort has implemented a zero-waste policy, where all food waste is composted and used to fertilize the organic farm. They also encourage visitors to avoid using single-use plastics and offer reusable water bottles to reduce waste.

These dining options not only promote sustainable and ethical dining practices but also support local farmers and food producers.
